concepts.concept_name: External body parts and their functions

in_scope: Major external body parts: head, eyes, ears, nose, mouth, hands, legs, fingers, toes
Five senses: sight, hearing, smell, taste, touch
Sense organs: eyes, ears, nose, tongue, skin
Simple functions: eyes for seeing, ears for hearing, nose for smelling, tongue for tasting, skin for feeling
Basic hygiene habits: brushing teeth, bathing, washing hands, combing hair, cutting nails
out_of_scope: Internal organs like heart, lungs, brain - Introduced in Class 3
Detailed anatomy or body systems - Introduced in Class 4
Diseases and their causes - Introduced in Class 3
Nervous system details - Introduced in Class 5

concepts.concept_name: Types of families and living together
Caring for each other in a family

in_scope: Family members: mother, father, brother, sister, grandparents, uncle, aunt
Small family (nuclear) and big family (joint family)
Roles of family members: who cooks, who works, who takes care of children
Loving, sharing, and helping each other at home
Family celebrations and festivals
out_of_scope: Extended family trees and complex relationships - Introduced in Class 2
Community and neighbourhood - Introduced in Class 2
Types of houses and shelters - Introduced in Class 2
Social studies concepts like rights and duties - Introduced in Class 3

concepts.concept_name: Types of plants: trees, shrubs, and herbs
Uses of plants in daily life

in_scope: Parts of a plant: root, stem, leaf, flower, fruit
Trees are big and tall with thick stems (neem, mango, banyan)
Shrubs are medium-sized bushy plants (rose, hibiscus)
Herbs are small soft plants (tulsi, mint, coriander)
Plants give us food, oxygen, shade, wood, and medicines
Plants need water, sunlight, and air to grow
out_of_scope: Photosynthesis - Introduced in Class 3
Plant reproduction and pollination - Introduced in Class 4
Classification of plants by seeds - Introduced in Class 3
Detailed anatomy of plant cells - Introduced in Class 6

concepts.concept_name: Body coverings and sounds of animals

in_scope: Domestic animals: cow, dog, cat, hen, goat, horse, buffalo
Wild animals: lion, tiger, elephant, monkey, deer, snake, peacock
Pet animals: dog, cat, parrot, fish
Body coverings: fur, feathers, scales, shell
Animal sounds: dog barks, cat meows, cow moos, lion roars
Animal homes: kennel, stable, coop, den, nest, burrow
out_of_scope: Animal classification (vertebrates/invertebrates) - Introduced in Class 3
Food chains and food webs - Introduced in Class 4
Adaptation and evolution - Introduced in Class 5
Endangered species and conservation - Introduced in Class 4

concepts.concept_name: Types of food and food groups
Where food comes from (plants and animals)

in_scope: Fruits: mango, banana, apple, guava, papaya, orange
Vegetables: potato, tomato, carrot, spinach, onion, peas
Grains: rice, wheat (roti/chapati), dal
Food from animals: milk, eggs, honey
Healthy food vs junk food
Eating meals at the right time, drinking water
Food from plants: fruits, vegetables, grains, spices
out_of_scope: Nutrients (proteins, carbohydrates, fats, vitamins) - Introduced in Class 3
Food preservation and cooking methods - Introduced in Class 3
Digestive system - Introduced in Class 4
Food safety and contamination - Introduced in Class 4

in_scope: Types of houses: kutcha house, pucca house, flat, hut, bungalow
Rooms in a house: bedroom, kitchen, bathroom, living room, balcony
Activities at home: sleeping, cooking, eating, studying, playing
Neighbourhood places: school, park, shop, hospital, post office, temple/mosque/church/gurudwara
Keeping our home and neighbourhood clean
out_of_scope: House construction materials in detail - Introduced in Class 3
Urban and rural differences in detail - Introduced in Class 3
Municipal services and governance - Introduced in Class 4
Architecture and design of buildings - Introduced in Class 5

in_scope: Major festivals: Diwali, Holi, Eid, Christmas, Pongal, Baisakhi, Onam, Raksha Bandhan
National days: Republic Day (26 January), Independence Day (15 August)
How festivals are celebrated: lights, sweets, new clothes, prayers, colours
Family and friends come together during festivals
Sharing food, gifts, and happiness with everyone
out_of_scope: Detailed religious history of festivals - Introduced in Class 3
State-specific festivals in detail - Introduced in Class 3
Cultural diversity and comparative religion - Introduced in Class 4
Historical significance of national days - Introduced in Class 3

concepts.concept_name: People who help us and their roles

in_scope: Community helpers: doctor, teacher, police officer, firefighter, farmer, postman
Other helpers: shopkeeper, auto-rickshaw driver, bus driver, sweeper, cook
What each helper does: doctor treats sick people, teacher teaches, farmer grows food
Tools they use: stethoscope (doctor), chalk and board (teacher), hose (firefighter)
We should respect and thank all helpers for their work
out_of_scope: Detailed career education - Introduced in Class 3
Government and public services in detail - Introduced in Class 4
Labour laws and workers' rights - Introduced in Class 5
Professional qualifications - Introduced in Class 4

concepts.concept_name: Types of transport: land, water, and air

in_scope: Land transport: car, bus, auto-rickshaw, bicycle, train, truck, scooter, bullock cart
Water transport: boat, ship, ferry
Air transport: aeroplane, helicopter
Vehicles we see daily on Indian roads
Basic road safety: look left-right before crossing, use zebra crossing, wear seatbelt, traffic lights
out_of_scope: How engines and machines work - Introduced in Class 4
History of transport - Introduced in Class 3
Fuels and energy sources - Introduced in Class 4
Traffic rules and regulations in detail - Introduced in Class 3

in_scope: Good manners: saying please, thank you, sorry, excuse me
Daily habits: brushing teeth, bathing, washing hands before eating, sleeping on time
Keeping surroundings clean: not littering, using dustbin, clean drinking water
Road safety: looking both ways, walking on footpath, not playing on the road
Stranger safety: not going with strangers, telling parents if someone makes you uncomfortable
out_of_scope: First aid and emergency procedures - Introduced in Class 3
Diseases and prevention in detail - Introduced in Class 3
Environmental pollution - Introduced in Class 4
Cyber safety and digital literacy - Introduced in Class 4
